title: Installing Angular CLI
content:
The Angular CLI (Command Line Interface) is the official tool for creating, building, and managing Angular applications. It provides powerful commands to scaffold projects, generate components, and optimize builds.

Before installing Angular CLI, make sure you have Node.js installed on your system. Angular requires Node.js version 16.14 or later.

codeExamples.title: Installing Angular CLI
codeExamples.code:
# Install Angular CLI globally
npm install -g @angular/cli

# Verify installation
ng version

# Check available commands
ng help
codeExamples.explanation: The -g flag installs Angular CLI globally, making the 'ng' command available from anywhere in your terminal.

codeExamples.title: Creating a New Project
codeExamples.code:
# Create a new Angular project
ng new my-angular-app

# Navigate to project directory
cd my-angular-app

# Start development server
ng serve

# Open browser to http://localhost:4200
codeExamples.explanation: The 'ng new' command creates a complete Angular project with all necessary files, dependencies, and configuration.

codeExamples.title: Generating Components
codeExamples.code:
# Generate a new component
ng generate component my-component

# Short form
ng g c my-component

# Generate with routing
ng g c my-component --routing

# Generate inline template and styles
ng g c my-component --inline-template --inline-style
codeExamples.explanation: The CLI can generate various Angular artifacts like components, services, modules, and more with proper file structure and imports.

exercises.title: Set Up Your Development Environment
exercises.description: Install Angular CLI and create your first project to verify everything is working correctly.
hints: Make sure Node.js is installed first (check with 'node --version')
Use npm to install Angular CLI globally
Create a test project to verify the installation
Try generating a component to test the CLI
exercises.solution:
# Step 1: Check Node.js
node --version
npm --version

# Step 2: Install Angular CLI
npm install -g @angular/cli

# Step 3: Verify installation
ng version

# Step 4: Create test project
ng new test-app --routing --style=scss
cd test-app

# Step 5: Test component generation
ng generate component welcome

# Step 6: Start development server
ng serve
